column1:
Title: Summary comparison - correctness policy

Objective
Evaluate which summary includes less false information.

Instructions
You are given 2 summaries (A, B) created from a reference text. Evaluate which summary includes less false information.

Scoring Criteria
A significantly better than B (Score: -2)
A slightly better than B (Score: -1)
Neither A or B is better than the other (Score: 0)
B slightly better than A (Score: 1)
B significantly better than B (Score 2)
column2:
Title: Summary comparison - correctness policy

Objective
Evaluate which summary includes less false information.

Instructions
You are given 2 summaries (A, B) created from a reference text. Evaluate which summary includes less false information. Consider the accuracy and completeness of the information presented in each summary.

Scoring Criteria
A significantly better than B (Score: -2)
A slightly better than B (Score: -1)
Neither A or B is better than the other (Score: 0)
B slightly better than A (Score: 1)
B significantly better than A (Score: 2)

Note: In evaluating the summaries, prioritize accuracy and completeness of information over the organization and presentation of the findings. Ensure that both the key findings and their details are accurately represented in the chosen summary.
column3:
Title: Summary comparison - accuracy and completeness policy

Objective
Evaluate which summary accurately and completely represents the information from the reference text.

Instructions
You are given 2 summaries (A, B) created from a reference text. Evaluate which summary accurately and completely represents the information from the reference text. Consider the accuracy and completeness of the information presented in each summary.

Scoring Criteria
A significantly better than B (Score: -2)
A slightly better than B (Score: -1)
Neither A or B is better than the other (Score: 0)
B slightly better than A (Score: 1)
B significantly better than A (Score: 2)

Note: In evaluating the summaries, prioritize accuracy and completeness of information over the organization and presentation of the findings. Ensure that both the key findings and their details are accurately represented in the chosen summary. Additionally, pay close attention to the specific details mentioned in the reference text and ensure that they are accurately reflected in the chosen summary.
column4:
Title: Summary comparison - accuracy and completeness policy

Objective
Evaluate which summary accurately and completely represents the information from the reference text.

Instructions
You are given 2 summaries (A, B) created from a reference text. Evaluate which summary accurately and completely represents the information from the reference text. Consider the accuracy and completeness of the information presented in each summary.

Scoring Criteria
A significantly better than B (Score: -2)
A slightly better than B (Score: -1)
Neither A or B is better than the other (Score: 0)
B slightly better than A (Score: 1)
B significantly better than A (Score: 2)

Note: In evaluating the summaries, prioritize accuracy and completeness of information over the organization and presentation of the findings. Ensure that both the key findings and their details are accurately represented in the chosen summary. Additionally, pay close attention to the specific details mentioned in the reference text and ensure that they are accurately reflected in the chosen summary. If there are discrepancies in specific details between the summaries and the reference text, prioritize the summary that accurately represents the majority of the key findings and their details. If both summaries accurately represent the majority of the key findings and their details, then neither A nor B is better than the other.

If both summaries accurately represent the majority of the key findings and their details, then neither A nor B is better than the other.

Note: In evaluating the summaries, prioritize accuracy and completeness of information over the organization and presentation of the findings. Additionally, pay close attention to the specific details mentioned in the reference text and ensure that they are accurately reflected in the chosen summary. If there are discrepancies in specific details between the summaries and the reference text, prioritize the summary that accurately represents the majority of the key findings and their details. If one summary accurately captures all the details while the other does not, assign a score based on the level of completeness and accuracy demonstrated in each summary.
